vulnerabilities.title: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Potential command injection using os.system. User input should never be passed directly to system commands.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: Critical operation with unvalidated input. Always validate and sanitize user input before use.

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before command injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-78: Command injection
    user_input = input('Enter command: ')
    os.system(user_input)  # Dangerous
    
    # CWE-89: SQL injection

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before sql injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-89: SQL injection  
    query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_input}"
    conn.execute(query)

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description: Potential XSS. Sanitize user input or use textContent.

vulnerabilities.title: Unsafe Deserialization
vulnerabilities.description: Unsafe deserialization of untrusted data. Validate input first.

vulnerabilities.title: Dangerous Function Usage
vulnerabilities.description: Use of dangerous function: eval. Avoid dynamic code execution.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: State-changing operation without CSRF protection. Implement CSRF tokens for state-changing operations.
